intro: Leontodon hieracioides, commonly known as the common hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its yellow flowers are arranged in a single, flat head. The plant is known for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
